alert.note: Alert for Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 13 at 3:11PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Washington and Orange Counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact Tuesday morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Amounts will be elevation dependent. Accumulations will likely be limited to grassy, elevated surfaces tonight. Increasing snowfall rates will result in greater accumulations on Tuesday. Isolated to scattered power outages are possible, along with blowing snow at higher elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
